title: Unfair Punishment
body:
Hello, Recently my friend has been receiving unfair punishment and got his account permanently suspended without proper warning. In the case of the perma ban we were playing a game together where we both did poorly in bot (not trolling and not even feeding for that matter) So we were getting flamed by our jungle hardcore saying that we're trolling and inting or should I say (YOU F***ING TROLLS) so we both tried to get him to calm down but he had just kept going and going we both just said to kys and he revived a perma ban from just one sentence, or acronym, while a angry flamer gets off scot-free.

His name is Blue Balls Shaco btw and he also got a ban for both him and i saying kys to our party member and our other teammates reported him. We aren't actually toxic just constant flaming is quite annoying and is hard not to respond to.

Side note if someone sarcastically says something about the mute button I will kill a whale cause we both do use it after a bit.

replies.body:
Telling another player to kill themselves is one of Riot's strictest zero-tolerance policies, and, while someone flaming you is frustrating, telling them to end their life is *not* an appropriate or acceptable response.

Which the punishment is aggressively tuned, a permanent ban for this likely means there was previous punishment history, as it normally earns an immediate 14-day ban. It is not, however, an unfair punishment.

Sigh, my only concern as a third party is that "were both sides punished equally and just?"
I mean, flaming a person to his breaking point is a offence that is on a same level. 
And the community does not want these sort of people as well.
No the other side (our jungler) remains unpunished as i reported him for being just as toxic and no notification was sent out saying he was banned.
There is rarely a notification sent out when someone gets punished and they aren't sent to everyone that reported the person when one is sent out.

> [{quoted}](name=Craft Zeppelin,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l4HNo7IM,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2018-03-28T03:54:13.772+0000)
>
> Sigh, my only concern as a third party is that "were both sides punished equally and just?"

There may have been: the notification is not always sent out. But it's alao possible that, while bad, the initial flamer is normally well behaved enough that a single occurance just increased his proximity to a punishment rather than inflicting one. If he did not violate any Zero Tolerance policies it's possible that he did not receive a punishment for this particular game.

I understand that entirely but how come there was no punishment sent out for the one to push him to his breaking point to where the toxicity comes out? It's not like we get enjoyment out of telling someone to off themselves, it's just that we got so fed up with being called useless that unintentional words slip out

Edit: Also it should be noted that we had no idea how strict the punishments are for telling someone to kys

> [{quoted}](name=Chris Rock,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=l4HNo7IM,comment-id=00000001,timestamp=2018-03-28T04:40:28.464+0000)I understand that entirely but how come there was no punishment sent out for the one to push him to his breaking point to where the toxicity comes out?

There may have been: the notification is not always sent out. But it's alao possible that, while bad, he is normally well behaved enough that a single occurance just increased his proximity to a punishment rather than inflicting one.

> Edit: Also it should be noted that we had no idea how strict the punishments are for telling someone to kys

Sadly, ignorance of the rule is not an excuse.
